Setting.Name: Number of partitions for k-fold test

Comment.Text: Then comes the feature extraction part. The signal is filtered in the alpha/beta [8 24] Hz range. Then the Stimulation Based Epoching box is used to select four seconds of signal half a second after the instruction was shown to the user (OVTK_GDF_Left and OVTK_GDF_Right). The signal is then splitted in blocks of 1 second every 16th second and the logarithmic band power is computed thanks to the two Simple DSP and the Signal Average boxes. The matrices can then be converted in feature vectors. note: depending on what frequency range reacts best for the subject, you may have to tune this part of the scenario note: whatever change you do on this scenario, don't forget to do the same on the classifier trainer scenario

The preprocessing of this scenario consists in re-referencing all the channels to the channel 2 (which was located on the nose) and to select the 10 channels over the motor cortex of the hands. The Spatial Filter box computes a surface laplacian filter and reduces the output to two channels: one on the left and one on the right. note: depending on your acquisition device, you may have to tune this part of the scenario note: whatever change you do on this scenario, don't forget to do the same on the online scenario

Overview This scenario should be used to train the LDA classifier used to detect left / right hand movements Just configure the Generic Stream Reader box to point to the last file you recorded with scenario 1-acquisition and fast forward this scenario. At the end of the training, you will have an estimation of the classifier performance printed in the console. If this performance is lower than 65%, just run a new 1-acquisition session to have better results.
The Classifier Trainer box produces a configuration file at the end of the experiment which will be used during online sessions.
You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1
